title: Final Year Project
text:
A picture of me
Welcome to my homepage! I am Eugine, an Applied Artificial Intelligence undergraduate student in Singapore Institute of Technology. An interesting fact about myself is I love nature! In this webpage, I will be sharing on a memorable final year project that I have done in polytechnic which fostered my interest in technology.

title: Final Year Project
text:
Introduction
In my final year, I worked together with the project supervisor, Dr Arun Kumar in further developing a gamified music system that serves as a complementary approach for children undergoing upper extremities rehabilitation.

title: Hobby Introduction: Mountain Climbing
text:
Welcome to the exhilarating world of mountain climbing! My name is Eugine, and I’m passionate about scaling peaks and exploring the wonders of nature from great heights.


For me, mountain climbing is more than just a hobby; it’s a way of life. The challenge of conquering steep slopes, the breathtaking views from the summit, and the sense of accomplishment when reaching the peak are unparalleled experiences that keep me coming back for more.



My fascination with mountain climbing began at a young age when I embarked on my first hike up a local hill. Since then, I’ve ventured to various mountain ranges around the world, from the rugged peaks of the Himalayas to the majestic summits of the Alps.

A picture of the mountain I hiked 




One of the things I love most about mountain climbing is the opportunity it provides for personal growth and self-discovery. Each climb presents its own set of obstacles, pushing me to test my limits both physically and mentally. It’s a journey of resilience, determination, and inner strength.



Mountain climbing is not just about reaching the top; it’s also about the camaraderie and sense of community among fellow climbers. Whether it’s swapping stories around a campfire or lending a helping hand on a difficult ascent, the bonds forged on the mountain are unlike any other.



If you’re looking for a thrilling adventure that will challenge you in ways you never thought possible, I highly recommend giving mountain climbing a try. From the rush of adrenaline to the serenity of being surrounded by nature, it’s an experience that will leave you craving more.
So grab your gear, lace up your boots, and join me as we ascend to new heights together!

title: Ratatouille Recipe
text:
1 large eggplant
2 medium zucchinis
1 large onion
2 bell peppers (red and yellow)
4 ripe tomatoes
4 cloves garlic
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 teaspoon dried thyme
1 teaspoon dried oregano
Salt and pepper to taste
Fresh basil leaves for garnish





Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Wash and dice the eggplant, zucchinis, onion, bell peppers, and tomatoes into small cubes.
Mince the garlic cloves.
In a large oven-safe skillet or baking dish, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the minced garlic and sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the diced onion to the skillet and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the diced eggplant, zucchinis, bell peppers, and tomatoes.
Season the vegetables with dried thyme, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. Mix well to combine.
Cover the skillet or baking dish with a lid or aluminum foil and transfer it to the preheated oven.
Bake for 30-40 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and cooked through.
Once cooked, remove the skillet or baking dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
Garnish the ratatouille with fresh basil leaves before serving.
Serve hot as a side dish or as a main course with crusty bread or cooked rice.

Enjoy your delicious homemade ratatouille!
